meanings.sent1: The nutrients are transported extracellularly to the neighboring cells.
meanings.sent2: The waste is disposed of extracellularly, away from the cell.
meanings.sent3: The cell waved goodbye as the nutrients traveled extracellularly to their destination.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the cell were whispered extracellularly, spreading far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight bathed the cell extracellularly, providing warmth and energy.

meanings.definition: In a location outside of a cell
meanings.sent1: The virus spread extracellularly, infecting nearby cells.
meanings.sent2: The enzyme functions extracellularly, breaking down molecules outside the cell.
meanings.sent3: The cell danced happily as its contents moved extracellularly for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: The information flowed extracellularly, reaching every corner of the organism.
meanings.sent5: The sound echoed extracellularly, creating a symphony of life outside the cell.
